metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45693 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Jettison before v1.5.2 was discovered to contain a stack overflow via the map parameter. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via a crafted string.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjettison-java - 1.2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libjettison-java package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
